00027 #ifndef CYAML_H
00028 #define CYAML_H
00029 
00030 #include <stdbool.h>
00031 
00032 enum cYAML_object_type {
00033         CYAML_TYPE_FALSE = 0,
00034         CYAML_TYPE_TRUE,
00035         CYAML_TYPE_NULL,
00036         CYAML_TYPE_NUMBER,
00037         CYAML_TYPE_STRING,
00038         CYAML_TYPE_ARRAY,
00039         CYAML_TYPE_OBJECT
00040 };
00041 
00042 struct cYAML {
00043         /* next/prev allow you to walk array/object chains. */
00044         struct cYAML *cy_next, *cy_prev;
00045         /* An array or object item will have a child pointer pointing
00046            to a chain of the items in the array/object. */
00047         struct cYAML *cy_child;
00048         /* The type of the item, as above. */
00049         enum cYAML_object_type cy_type;
00050 
00051         /* The item's string, if type==CYAML_TYPE_STRING */
00052         char *cy_valuestring;
00053         /* The item's number, if type==CYAML_TYPE_NUMBER */
00054         int cy_valueint;
00055         /* The item's number, if type==CYAML_TYPE_NUMBER */
00056         double cy_valuedouble;
00057         /* The item's name string, if this item is the child of,
00058            or is in the list of subitems of an object. */
00059         char *cy_string;
00060         /* user data which might need to be tracked per object */
00061         void *cy_user_data;
00062 };
00063 
00064 typedef void (*cYAML_user_data_free_cb)(void *);
00065 
00066 /*
00067  * cYAML_walk_cb
00068  *   Callback called when recursing through the tree
00069  *
00070  *   cYAML* - pointer to the node currently being visitied
00071  *   void* - user data passed to the callback.
00072  *   void** - output value from the callback
00073  *
00074  * Returns true to continue recursing.  false to stop recursing
00075  */
00076 typedef bool (*cYAML_walk_cb)(struct cYAML *, void *, void**);
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * cYAML_build_tree
00080  *   Build a tree representation of the YAML formatted text passed in.
00081  *
00082  *   yaml_file - YAML file to parse and build tree representation
00083  *   yaml_blk - blk of YAML.  yaml_file takes precedence if both
00084  *   are defined.
00085  *   yaml_blk_size - length of the yaml block (obtained via strlen)
00086  */
00087 struct cYAML *cYAML_build_tree(char *yaml_file, const char *yaml_blk,
00088                                 size_t yaml_blk_size,
00089                                 struct cYAML **err_str);
00090 
00091 /*
00092  * cYAML_print_tree
00093  *   Print the textual representation of a YAML tree to stderr
00094  *
00095  *   node - Node where you want to start printing
00096  */
00097 void cYAML_print_tree(struct cYAML *node);
00098 
00099 /*
00100  * cYAML_print_tree2file
00101  *   Print the textual representation of a YAML tree to file
00102  *
00103  *   f - file to print to
00104  *   node - Node where you want to start printing
00105  */
00106 void cYAML_print_tree2file(FILE *f, struct cYAML *node);
00107 
00108 /*
00109  * cYAML_free_tree
00110  *   Free the cYAML tree returned as part of the cYAML_build_tree
00111  *
00112  *   node - root of the tree to be freed
00113  */
00114 void cYAML_free_tree(struct cYAML *node);
00115 
00116 /*
00117  * cYAML_get_object_item
00118  *   Returns the cYAML object which key correspods to the name passed in
00119  *   This function searches only through the current level.
00120  *
00121  *   parent - is the parent object on which you want to conduct the search
00122  *   name - key name of the object you want to find.
00123  */
00124 struct cYAML *cYAML_get_object_item(struct cYAML *parent,
00125                                     const char *name);
00126 
00127 /*
00128  * cYAML_get_next_seq_item
00129  *   Returns the next item in the YAML sequence.  This function uses the
00130  *   itm parameter to keep track of its position in the sequence.  If the
00131  *   itm parameter is reset to NULL between calls that resets and returns
00132  *   the first item in the sequence.
00133  *   This function returns NULL when there are no more items in the
00134  *   sequence.
00135  *
00136  *   seq - is the head node of the YAML sequence
00137  *   itm - [OUT] next sequence item to continue looking from next time.
00138  *
00139  */
00140 struct cYAML *cYAML_get_next_seq_item(struct cYAML *seq,
00141                                       struct cYAML **itm);
00142 
00143 /*
00144  * cYAML_is_seq
00145  *   Returns 1 if the node provided is an ARRAY 0 otherwise
00146  *
00147  *   node - the node to examine
00148  *
00149  */
00150 bool cYAML_is_sequence(struct cYAML *node);
00151 
00152 /*
00153  * cYAML_find_object
00154  *   Returns the cYAML object which key correspods to the name passed in
00155  *   this function searches the entire tree.
00156  *
00157  *   root - is the root of the tree on which you want to conduct the search
00158  *   name - key name of the object you want to find.
00159  */
00160 struct cYAML *cYAML_find_object(struct cYAML *root, const char *key);
00161 
00162 /*
00163  * cYAML_clean_usr_data
00164  *   walks the tree and for each node with some user data it calls the
00165  *   free_cb with the user data as a parameter.
00166  *
00167  *   node: node to start the walk from
00168  *   free_cb: cb to call to cleanup the user data
00169  */
00170 void cYAML_clean_usr_data(struct cYAML *node,
00171                           cYAML_user_data_free_cb free_cb);
00172 
00173 /*
00174  * cYAML_create_object
00175  *  Creates a CYAML of type OBJECT
00176  *
00177  *  parent - parent node
00178  *  key - node key
00179  */
00180 struct cYAML *cYAML_create_object(struct cYAML *parent, char *key);
00181 
00182 /*
00183  * cYAML_create_seq
00184  *  Creates a CYAML of type ARRAY
00185  *  Once this is created, more sequence items can be added.
00186  *
00187  *  parent - parent node
00188  *  key - node key
00189  */
00190 struct cYAML *cYAML_create_seq(struct cYAML *parent, char *key);
00191 
00192 /*
00193  * cYAML_create_object
00194  *  Create a sequence item, which can have more entites added underneath
00195  *  it
00196  *
00197  *  parent - parent node
00198  */
00199 struct cYAML *cYAML_create_seq_item(struct cYAML *seq);
00200 
00201 /*
00202  * cYAML_create_string
00203  *   Creates a cYAML node of type STRING
00204  *
00205  *   parent - parent node
00206  *   key - node key
00207  *   value - value of node
00208  */
00209 struct cYAML *cYAML_create_string(struct cYAML *parent, char *key,
00210                                   char *value);
00211 
00212 /*
00213  * cYAML_create_string
00214  *   Creates a cYAML node of type STRING
00215  *
00216  *   parent - parent node
00217  *   key - node key
00218  *   value - value of node
00219  */
00220 struct cYAML *cYAML_create_number(struct cYAML *parent, char *key,
00221                                   double value);
00222 
00223 /*
00224  * cYAML_insert_sibling
00225  *   inserts one cYAML object as a sibling to another
00226  *
00227  *   root - root node to have a sibling added to
00228  *   sibling - sibling to be added
00229  */
00230 void cYAML_insert_sibling(struct cYAML *root, struct cYAML *sibling);
00231 
00232 /*
00233  * cYAML_insert_child
00234  *   inserts one cYAML object as a child to another
00235  *
00236  *   parent - parent node to have a child added to
00237  *   child - child to be added
00238  */
00239 void cYAML_insert_child(struct cYAML *parent, struct cYAML *node);
00240 
00241 /*
00242  * cYAML_build_error
00243  *   Build a YAML error message given:
00244  *
00245  *   rc - return code to add in the error
00246  *   seq_no - a sequence number to add in the error
00247  *   cmd - the command that failed.
00248  *   entity - command entity that failed.
00249  *   err_str - error string to add in the error
00250  *   root - the root to which to add the YAML error
00251  */
00252 void cYAML_build_error(int rc, int seq_no, char *cmd,
00253                         char *entity, char *err_str,
00254                         struct cYAML **root);
00255 
00256 
00257 #endif /* CYAML_H */
